column4: is anyone else here having problems with Flash content in Firefox?
it almost seems like the Flash content is in a layer that floats over everything else....dropdown menus will dissapear behind it, I'm getting large swaths of text surrounding it that vanish.....
weird, I've never heard of anything like that.  All flash messed up for me was sound.
like some large blank border surrounding the content, covering over the text that should be there
I'm getting used to that....I'll have these problems that keep repeating, and nobody else seems to have them....weird indeed :)
I notice, though, that when I run the Windows version of Firefox under Wine, I don't have any of those problems

I'm not going to lie, I'm quite disappointed with Firefox on Linux.  For me when I was using 32-bit , Firefox seriously crashed 1/4 sessions, specially around flash websites.  Now I'm using swiftweasel and it runs great
looking at the available .deb files for swiftweasel, is the m after pentium 3 and 4 for mobile versions?
not sure, go ahead and try, is there any other version besides the ones with the 'm' at the end?
I see versions ending pentium3.deb, pentium3m.deb, pentium4.deb, and pentium4m.deb
I'm actually using a Celeron M.....hmm, guess that means the M IS for mobile versions :)
anything tricky about getting Flash to run in Swiftweasel?  just put a link to the .so and .xpt files in the swiftweasel plugins folder?
I didn't need anything extra, just worked ... I thin it uses the firefox folders
ok, because about:plugins in Swift Weasel isn't showing that as being installed
nope, it appears not to be seeing it
hmm try copying it over, I'm using 64-bit Ubuntu so I had a script to automatically move all those things around :
